Breadcrumbs

Breadcrumbs enable users to quickly see their location within a navigation path and move up to a parent level if desired.

Examples

${require('html-loader?interpolate!../../partials/toggles.html')}

Guidelines

Breadcrumbs should appear when the system has more than two layers in a hierarchy, or when the application has a multi-layer architecture. Use breadcrumbs when it is important that the user have visibility to their place within a navigation hierarchy, or when the user will regularly need to quickly navigate back to a higher level.

Modifiers

Class Description
.uxf-breadcrumb-drop-last add class to ol.breadcrumb element to drop and enlarge li.active

Convert from UXFrame v1 to v2

  1. Change ul.breadcrumb to ol.breadcrumb
  2. Surround ol.breadcrumb with nav aria-label="breadcrumb"
  3. Move .drop-last to ol.breadcrumb element; Change it to .breadcrumb-drop-last
  4. Add .active class on the last li
